TITLE: Using DataClassFormatType for Various Formatting Options
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the DataClassFormatType enum to control the formatting of custom DataClass objects, including JSON and YAML signatures and schema generation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/SylphAI-Inc/AdalFlow/blob/main/tutorials/dataclass.ipynb#2025-04-14_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from adalflow.core import DataClassFormatType

json_signature = TrecData2.format_class_str(DataClassFormatType.SIGNATURE_JSON)
print(json_signature)

yaml_signature = TrecData2.format_class_str(DataClassFormatType.SIGNATURE_YAML)
print(yaml_signature)

schema = TrecData2.format_class_str(DataClassFormatType.SCHEMA)
print(schema)
```

TITLE: REALM Loss Function Calculation (LaTeX)
DESCRIPTION: This LaTeX equation defines the loss function used in REALM. It represents the log-likelihood of the correct prediction, which is the training objective for optimizing the retriever.
SOURCE: https://github.com/SylphAI-Inc/AdalFlow/blob/main/docs/source/tutorials/rag_playbook.rst#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: latex
CODE:
```
\mathcal{L} = \log p(y | x) = \log \left( \sum_{z \in Z} p(y | z, x) \cdot p(z | x) \right)
```

TITLE: Defining Trainable Prompts as Parameters in AdalFlow
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to define trainable prompts as parameters in AdalFlow. It shows examples for both a system prompt and few-shot demonstrations, which can be optimized during training.
SOURCE: https://github.com/SylphAI-Inc/AdalFlow/blob/main/docs/source/new_tutorials/generator.rst#2025-04-14_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from adalflow.optim.parameter import ParameterType

system_prompt = adal.Parameter(
        data="You will answer a reasoning question. Think step by step. The last line of your response should be of the following format: 'Answer: $VALUE' where VALUE is a numerical value.",
        role_desc="To give task instruction to the language model in the system prompt",
        requires_opt=True,
        param_type=ParameterType.PROMPT,
        instruction_to_optimizer="You can try to show examples to see if it helps.",
)

few_shot_demos = adal.Parameter(
        data=None,
        role_desc="To provide few shot demos to the language model",
        requires_opt=True,
        param_type=ParameterType.DEMOS,
)
```

TITLE: Styling HTML Container for Computation Graph Visualization
DESCRIPTION: CSS styling for a responsive iframe container that displays the computation graph visualization. Includes styling for the container, iframe, and zoom controls with positioning and layout properties.
SOURCE: https://github.com/SylphAI-Inc/AdalFlow/blob/main/docs/source/use_cases/qa_computation_graph.rst#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
<style>
.iframe-container {
    width: 100%;
    height: 100vh; /* Full height of the viewport */
    max-height: 1000px; /* Maximum height to ensure it doesn't get too tall on larger screens */
    overflow: hidden;
    position: relative;
}
.iframe-container iframe {
    width: 100%;
    height: 100%;
    border: none;
}
.zoom-controls {
    position: absolute;
    top: 10px;
    right: 10px;
    display: flex;
    gap: 10px;
}
.zoom-controls button {
    padding: 5px 10px;
    cursor: pointer;
}
</style>
```

TITLE: Styling Class Hierarchy Visualization with CSS
DESCRIPTION: CSS styles to create a responsive iframe container for displaying the class hierarchy visualization. The styles ensure proper display across different screen sizes, with specific adjustments for mobile viewports.
SOURCE: https://github.com/SylphAI-Inc/AdalFlow/blob/main/docs/source/tutorials/class_hierarchy.rst#2025-04-14_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: css
CODE:
```
.iframe-container {
    width: 100%;
    height: 100vh; /* Full height of the viewport */
    max-height: 1000px; /* Maximum height to ensure it doesn't get too tall on larger screens */
    overflow: hidden;
}
.iframe-container iframe {
    width: 100%;
    height: 100%;
    border: none;
}
@media (max-width: 768px) {
    .iframe-container {
        height: 60vh; /* Adjust height for mobile viewports */
        max-height: none; /* Remove the maximum height constraint for small screens */
    }
}
```

TITLE: Explaining ReAct Agent Extensions in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This snippet details the extensions made to the original ReAct paper, including support for different types of tools and the flexibility of tool adaptation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/SylphAI-Inc/AdalFlow/blob/main/adalflow/adalflow/components/agent/README.md#2025-04-14_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
# The initial ReAct paper does not support different types of tools. We have greatly extended the flexibility of tool adaption, even including an llm tool
# to answer questions that cant be answered or better be answered by llm using its world knowledge.
# - Every react agent can be given a different tasks, different tools, and different LLM models to complete the task.
# - 'finish' tool is defined to finish the task by joining all subqueries answers.
```
